items.title: Indigenous communities are questioning the government's response to the Perth Invasion Day attack
items.summary: The attack is being investigated as a potential terrorist event, with some saying the government should have taken warnings from First Nations people more seriously.

items.title: Chinese officials heading to Brisbane to investigate hot coffee attack on baby
items.summary: Baby Luka has undergone at least eight surgeries since the attack, which left his face and body severely burned.

items.title: 'Existential threat': The 'mirror life' risk fuelling doomsday fears
items.summary: Scientists warn some biological developments could have devastating consequences. One focus of growing concern is "mirror life".

items.title: Trump warns Iran 'time is running out' for nuclear deal amid US military build-up
items.summary: The US president said an "armada" of US warships is now in the Middle East, as Iran threatened a massive response to any strikes.

items.title: Remains found in Tasmania during search for missing Belgian hiker Celine Cremer
items.summary: A bushwalker found the remains during a search for the 31-year-old, who was last seen in the area near Cradle Mountain in 2023.

items.title: Border agents involved in deadly Minnesota shooting placed on 'administrative leave'
items.summary: It comes as Donald Trump said he would "de-escalate" in Minnesota amid mounting political pressure over his immigration crackdown.

items.title: Xi Jinping has dismissed two of China's most senior generals. What does this mean?
items.summary: The two men are "suspected of serious violations of discipline and the law", China's defence ministry said.

items.title: How much more will you pay? First rate hike in two years now highly likely
items.summary: Inflation has jumped — and so have expectations of an interest rate rise.

items.title: How hot did it get? Temperature records confirmed as more extreme heat expected
items.summary: A senior meteorologist said there were "far too many records to list".

items.title: Nationals leader David Littleproud defends record ahead of leadership challenge
items.summary: A Nationals backbencher who argues a Coalition split is "political suicide" has revealed he will make a bid for leadership of the party.

items.title: Muslim leaders condemn Scott Morrison's 'reckless' and 'divisive' comments on Islam
items.summary: A plan proposed by the former prime minster has been backed by a Liberal senator but condemned by Muslim leaders and Islamic groups.

items.title: Check your device: Apple urges updates over triple-zero connectivity concerns
items.summary: Older iPhones and some Apple Watches could be impacted. Here's the full list.

items.title: Donald Trump vows to 'de-escalate' in Minnesota as Ilhan Omar attacked in Minneapolis
items.summary: Donald Trump is facing mounting political pressure to soften his administration's aggressive deportation tactics.

items.title: Protests rocked Iran. Now, 41,000 people face a chilling uncertainty
items.summary: A month after Iran's deadly protests, there are grave concerns about the use of capital punishment against thousands who have been arrested.

items.title: I’ve been sober for six years. Adjusting to life without alcohol was ‘excruciating’
items.summary: Sobriety podcaster Victoria Vanstone felt like alcohol turned her into a "sandal-wearing ogre". She says her kids deserved better.

items.title: Doomsday Clock set closer to midnight than ever before
items.summary: For a third year in a row, atomic scientists have moved the Doomsday Clock closer to midnight, the theoretical point of annihilation.

items.title: It's a crime most assume doesn't happen in Australia — but schools should be on alert
items.summary: Most reported victims are young women and girls — but anyone could be affected, the Australian Federal Police says.

items.title: Heat reprieve for some but others set for another sweltering day
items.summary: A cool change is expected for much of Victoria, while heatwave conditions continue in parts of south-east Australia after record heat.

items.title: De Minaur says he will 'keep on improving' following Australian Open quarter-final exit
items.summary: Following a straight-sets loss to world number one Carlos Alcaraz, Australia's highest-ranked men's player isn't giving up his grand slam hunt.

items.title: French lawmakers vote in favour of social media ban for under-15s
items.summary: The ban would make France the second country to take such a step after Australia.

items.title: The final Israeli hostage's remains have been recovered in Gaza. What happens now?
items.summary: Now that all the living and deceased hostages held by Hamas have been repatriated, the focus shifts to Rafah.

items.title: Albanese calls for Perth explosives suspect to face 'full force of the law'
items.summary: A man accused of throwing an explosive device into an Invasion Day rally crowd has faced court.

items.title: $335 million gone: How scams drained Australians in a single year
items.summary: These are the scams that have hit Australians hardest.
